tooltips.title: S Tier
tooltips.content:
Lately I've begun to think Bowling Bash has as much of an impact on my wins as cards like Scrawl, Talk to the Hand, and Vault. It especially shines during the act 2 elites, where it deals 60 damage for 1 mana. 
Bowling Bash has become an autopick for me until act 3 where the usefulness starts to fall off a bit, I'll even take 3 or 4 copies if they're offered.

tooltips.title: S Tier
tooltips.content: There are still quite a few situations where it shines in act 3, like dealing up to 150 damage to Reptomancer in divinity stance or the various multi-mob fights such as darklings.

tooltips.title: S Tier
tooltips.content: It does a bit of damage vs act 4 elites, but at that point you're looking for better combos than "slightly stronger strike".

tooltips.title: Judgment
tooltips.content:
So judgment is really good against the heart, it goes through the damage cap in case you don't draw the exit. 
It also shines greatly in act 3 where you can kill the daggers quickly. It doesn't have much scaling potential, but if you get a burst it intimidates the enemies twice as good. 
At the end of act 3 you can take out the cultists in the awakened one fight. Notice how judgment isn't a power card so it's really good against the awakened one. 
I really recommend the upgrade for the late game especially for the cultist kills. Even in single enemy fights it's really good, such as incrementing slow in giant head fight and going through intangible for nemesis. 
Overall it's a really generalists card, effective in almost all the fights, and it really shines in late game boss fights. 
Not only that, notice how it's a skill, so you can end your turn killing a minion with judgment and draw cards with sanctity next turn or activate crush joints to kill high health threats.
